content.description: Right of Donedoozler, awkwardly sit start on two large pockets. Avoiding anything too big and too far to the right, climb straight up and get into the undercling rail. Match in the jug before the roof and dropoff.
One of the few lines actually worth stopping here for. Stand start on good holds. Climb the gently overhanging face well into the scarry zone. Topout at only spot that is cleaned off.
content.location: Walk into the First Rocks area following the orange ribbons. In the first wide corridor you come accross, look on the right wall for this obvious king line.

content.description: Sit start on left facing jug flake.  Move up to a bad right hand, then figure out a way to get to the next good holds way up and left. Drop off at jug ledge before dirty roof.
content.location: At the very first boulder you will see at First Rocks, there is a dirty and chossy cap roof that is about 10 feet high. Under this roof, to the left of the campfire, you will find the starting hold for Furious Sky and The Donedoozler.

content.description: Under the dirty roof, sit start on left facing jug flake (same as Furious Sky) but this aim right towards a large sloper pocket, finishing with a big move to the jug ledge. Drop off.
content.location: At the first boulder you will see at First Rocks, there is a dirty and chossy roof about 10 feet tall. On the face below it you will find a few good climbs.

content.description: On your first trip, walk past this first group of boulders you will see on the left of access road immediately before getting to the pipeline. While there are a few problems worth doing, the rock is not anywhere near as quality as the other areas.
